text:
It takes some killer confidence to work a red lip while you're sweating it out, especially considering Tracy Anderson Method is known for its dance cardio-infused classes (which can already feel pretty vulnerable to many people). But it sounds like Ross is leaning right into it with her red lipstick look, and straight-up owning that pop of color.

She might be onto something with the shade of her lipstick, too—the color red has long been associated with confidence, and if that "you got this" feeling helps her push a little harder or squeeze in a few more reps, more power to her. (For the record, her lipstick of choice is MAC's matte Ruby Woo.)

And while you might've heard that wearing makeup while working out isn't great for your skin, it turns out that lipstick is actually the one product you can safely get away during a sweaty workout. While dermatologists warn that foundations and tinted moisturizers can mix with sweat and clog pores, potentially creating breakouts, and eye makeup can run into your eyes and irritate them, there's no harm in lipstick because your lips don't have sweat glands.

So if rocking a red lip like Ross helps pump up your workout, have at it. And if not, she's also proven that red lipstick is definitely not required to go all-in, especially when your jam comes on (judging by her enthusiasm here).
